IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: In February of 2023, TFC. Hadley of the Maryland State Police - Maryland State Apprehension Team / US Marshals - Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force, was requested to assist the US Marshals Service with locating and apprehending a fugitive identified as Donte David Fields B/M, DOB: 09/02/1995. Fields was wanted through the US Marshals Service in reference to a Federal Indictment out of West Virginia for Conspiracy PWID Heroin Fentanyl (3:23CR2-2). Fields was indicted on 01/04/2023. An inquiry into Fields revealed the following active warrants: 1. Loaded Handgun in Vehicle - Baltimore City Sheriffs Office VOP Warrant Case# 3B02430025 Issued 02/15/2023 2. Failure to Register Gun Offender Baltimore City Sheriffs Office Arrest Warrant Case# 6B02475535Issued 06/12/2023 3. Driving without a License Anne Arundel County Police Department Bench Warrant Case# 0DK0X40-1Issued 01/20/2023 4. CDS Marijuana 10+ grams Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack Bench Warrant Case# D-111-CR-21-060120Issued 03/10/2022 TFC Hadley conducted an in-depth background investigation into Fields family, friends, associates, social media, and pattern of life. During the course of the investigation, TFC Hadley identified a current Facebook and Instagram account for Fields. TFC. Hadley authored and obtained court ordered intelligence for both accounts.Upon Meta Platforms complying, TFC. Hadley began receiving and analyzing the intelligence which revealed no activity on both accounts. Task Force members discovered Fields to have a girlfriend named, Toni Wilder. It was also discovered that Wilder had a gray Toyota Van (VA: TUE1201) registered in her name. On August 30, 2023, the US Marshals Service received an anonymous tip that Fields and Wilder were staying at 3730 Boarman Ave, Baltimore, MD 21215. TFC Hadley contacted the company that owns the property, and they advised they purchased it back in March and were currently renovating it. The owner advised no one is living at the location and that they have been working there every day. On August 31, 2023, at approximately 0800 hours, TFC Hadley responded to the area of Boarman Avenue and spotted Wilders gray Toyota Van parked on the 3700 block of Boarman Avenue. As TFC Hadley drove by the vehicle, he spotted Fields in the driver seat, looking down at his phone. TFC Hadley positioned his vehicle on an adjacent street and kept an eye on the vehicle while additional Task Force members were called to the area. Within several minutes, the vehicle pulled off with Fields driving. TFC Hadley conducted a soft tail of the vehicle. After a short distance, Fields pulled into the Carroll Fuels Gas Station located at 3300 W Cold Spring Lane, Baltimore, MD 21215. TFC Hadley observed Fields exit the vehicle and begin to utilize the air pump at the location. TFC Hadley relayed all information to responding Task Force members and planned for an open air take-down. Once additional Task Force members were in the area and Fields was observed still putting air in his tires, an open air take-down was executed. Fields surrendered and was apprehended without incident. A search incident to arrest of Fields person, revealed a clear plastic baggie containing eleven (11) small plastic containers and two (2) glass viles of a white rock-like substance, suspected crack cocaine. The plastic bag containing all CDS was located in Fields front left pant pocket. TFC Hadley was able to identify the white rock-like substance as crack cocaine through his training, knowledge and experience as a Maryland State Trooper and multiple drug arrests. Through TFC Hadleys training, knowledge and experience he also recognized the quantity of CDS along with its individual packaging to be indicative of distribution. The CDS was also field tested and tested positive for cocaine. Cocaine is a schedule II controlled dangerous substance. The CDS was seized and store at the Maryland State Police Golden Ring Barrack under Property Held (P-339424). The total weight of the CDS was 9.1 grams. Fields was released into the custody of the US Marshals on scene and was transported to the Edward A. Garmatz United States District Courthouse for processing. TFC Hadley completed an application for statement of charges in reference to the CDS and received an arrest warrant (4B02454512) for Fields. Fields was charged with CDS W/I DIST: NARC and CDS: POSSESS-NOT CANNABIS. The warrant was lodged at the Golden Ring Barrack and entered into Meters/NCIC pending service.

IncidentProperty.Description: Eleven (11) plastic containers and two (2) glass viles containing a white-rock substance, suspected crack cocaine.
Eleven (11) plastic containers and two (2) glass viles containing a white-rock substance, suspected crack cocaine.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On January 1, 2024, I, TFC Hadley contacted the US Marshal Service in reference to Donte Fields. The US Marshal Service advised that Fields is still in Federal custody and is currently being held at the Eastern Regional Jail and Corrections Facility located at 94 Grapevine Rd, Martinsburg, WV 25405. Fields case is still on going and there is no projected release date. The US Marshal Service advised that Fields active warrant through the Maryland State Police is still lodged as a detainer. I request this case remain open until the service of Fields warrant.
